name: Travelodge Seattle by the Space Needle

reviews.text: Proximity to the Space Needle -great. Free Parking-great
reviews.title: Would stay there again

likes.disliked: — room was a bit dim and old-looking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms of average size (117),clean, good shower, thick towels, but not much in the way of toiletries.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good rate for a three night stay through website.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't much, but the donuts were so-o-o-o good and fresh.
reviews.title: Love the space needle

likes.liked: — Location to the space needle and victoria clipper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk people were excellent - helpful, courteous, polite.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: This hotel was 120 a night and close to the free bus zone and space needle. Those were the perks. The rest is awful. It was filthy dirty. They were understaffed and the desk clerks who were working were rude and not very knowledgable about the surrounding area. If you are looking to save some money and don't mind filth, then by all means book your room here. I would never recommend this hotel to any friends or family.
reviews.title: Not So Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm considering relocating to Seattle and spent nearly a week touring the area on a budget.
reviews.title: Can't recommend

likes.disliked: — Lack of cleanliness and unsafe surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even for the price (about $70 per night), this place was well below what I expected. The room and hallways were dirty; the smell of urine permeated the parking lot - seems several homeless people were sleeping behind the hedges at a neighboring business.
reviews.title: Good when on a budget

likes.disliked: — Pool noise could be a possible problem, something more than pastries for breakfast

reviews.text: There are other economical hotels in this same area -- try one of those instead.
reviews.title: cheap and unpleasant

likes.liked: — the location was convienient for sight seeing
likes.disliked: — the sleazy people hanging out in the lobby and outside

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights on a trip to Seattle. I don't expect much from budget accommodation, you do get what you pay for, but for the time that we actually spend at the hotel (left daily at 8am, back at 9:30pm) I cannot complain. The hotel is very well situated with a Starbucks (surprise!) just around the corner at a gas station. It is also a short walk from the Space Needle and the 5 Point Café. We had no trouble walking around at night. Our room overlooked the pool with the Jacuzzi/spa bath and on our first night it was a bit noisy outside. (In summer, one might have to keep that in mind.) After traveling for 24 hours the noise did not really bother us. The room was spacious, clean, it had a safe and a small fridge which came in handy. There is a bit of a gap between the room door and the floor which lets through a bit of light in the evening (if you like to sleep in total darkness like I do), but a towel quickly sorted that out. Our towels were nice and fluffy and that there was no bath did not bother us at all. The hotel lift is a bit stuffy. The breakfast is quite a sugary affair but coffee, orange juice, a wonderful Washington apple and a bagel can set you up for the start of the day. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Wasn't wild about the Travelodge

reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend staying here unless everything else was booked. For a few dollars more, you can stay at one of the other area hotels.
reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend

reviews.text: On the plus side the location was good - right near the needle and within walking distance to restaurants. The pool and whirlpool looked clean, although I didn't get a chance to try them out. There was a continental breakfast (donuts and coffee).
reviews.title: Nice location
A Bargin For Travelers
reviews.text: On the down side - the hotel lobby, halls and room had a dank, perfumed smell about it. Looked like the hotel itself could really use an overhall. The beds had big dips which were rather uncomfortable and I can usually sleep just about anywhere. The sheets were rather worn and I felt like I should sleep in my clothes.
We booked the room for two nights, but left after our first night there and went to the Best Western next door and slept much better.
reviews.title: Travelodge is very run down, Only thing good about it, is how close

reviews.text: The hotel was convenient for us. We could walk to the space needle, catch the bus to downtown. We took a tour and they picked us up right at the front door, went to a baseball game and the desk arrranged transportation to and from. the heated pool was nice, breakfast of ok, nothing fantastic but we have had worse. It does need remodeling but it was clean and the price was right. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: The price is about right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the midst of some required upgrades. They offer free breakfast with 26 items, such as hot belgium waffles and Seattle's Best coffee. The hotel room itself was clean - however, it did require some minor touch-ups, which will hopefully be addressed with the overhaul.
reviews.title: Upgrades Underway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband ventured out late at night to the corner store at the gas station, and the area had some people of ill repute working at that time. However, the hotel lobby door gets locked at night, and people are buzzed in, so the hotel premises were safe. Several hotels in the area contend with this challenge.
reviews.title: Would Go Somewhere Else

likes.disliked: — The noise of the Air con units constantly

reviews.text: Overall, it's an economical hotel that offers a good breakfast (they should, however, do away with the disposable dishes and cutlery for the sake of the environment), a clean room, and a great location that is mere minutes in walking distance to the Space Needle and the Monorail.
reviews.title: sickning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The proposed upgrades from new management have come with excellent timing.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 1 day and a night the hotel itself is cheap and cheerful but if you like the sound of Air con units all day and all night this is the place for you. We where also woken at 10:30PM by the desk clerk knocking on the door because they said our water was running all day , though it was not. This could have been handled much better and much earlier . All in all i would not stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: A Cheap Place to Stay

aka: Travelodge Seattle By The Space Needle Hotel Seattle
description: Travelodge-Seattle Center Caters to Both Extended-Stay and Single Night Guests. Enjoy a prime location to Seattle’s popular attractions when you stay at Travelodge-Seattle Center. In addition to recently upgraded and well-appointed accommodations that are perfect for all guests, you’ll enjoy quality services and amenities such as a seasonal outdoor pool, hot tub, fitness center, business center, and free wireless Internet access in both your room and around the hotel grounds.
